2.5 Vitamin A supplementation in children with measles
WHO RECOMMENDATION 
All children diagnosed with measles should receive one dose of a vitamin A supplement. 1 
Children from areas of known vitamin A deficiency or where measles case fatality is likely 
to be more than 1% should receive 2 doses of vitamin A supplements, given 24 hours 
apart, to help prevent eye damage and blindness. Vitamin A supplements have been 
shown to reduce the number of deaths from measles by 50%.
